      • formatPhoneNumber

        public static java.lang.String formatPhoneNumber(java.lang.String number)
        Returns: formatPhoneNumber(number, "(", ") ", "-") which formats a number to look like this: (555) 123-4567. Note: If you give too many numbers they'll just be added to the end of the number. Like this (555) 123-456789101112
        Parameters:
        number -
        Returns:
        formatted phone number

      • formatCreditCard

        public static java.lang.String formatCreditCard(java.lang.String creditCard,
                                java.lang.String separator)
        If the call was formatCreditCard("1234567812345678", "-") the result would be: 1234-5678-1234-5678. This will continue if you give too long or too short of a number. If you give 12345, the result will be: 1234-5. If you give 12345678123456789, it will return 1234-5678-1234-5678-9. NOTE: Also first calls NumberHelper.cleanNumber(creditCard).replace(".", "");
        Parameters:
        creditCard - the number string to format like a credit card number
        separator - the item to put between every 4 numbers
        Returns:
        formatted credit card

      • percentEncodeString

        public static java.lang.String percentEncodeString(java.lang.String originalString)
        This is posting something in a URL. It replaces anything in the string given with percentEncoded values
        Parameters:
        originalString -
        Returns:
